title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Mavericks Topple Knicks Behind Mashburn's Career Night**

DALLAS (AP) – In a defensive struggle where points were a premium, Jamal Mashburn authored a masterpiece.

The Dallas Mavericks rode a historic, career-high 50-point explosion from their star forward to outlast the New York Knicks, 91-83, in a gritty battle at Reunion Arena. While the Knicks’ defense clamped down on nearly everyone else, Mashburn was an unstoppable force, single-handedly carrying the Mavericks to a crucial victory.

The game was a typical, physical 90s affair, with neither team able to find consistent offensive rhythm. The Knicks, led by Patrick Ewing’s 20 points and 15 rebounds, ground their way through the paint. But for every basket New York manufactured, Mashburn had an answer. He sliced through the league’s toughest defense, hitting from every spot on the floor and getting to the foul line with relentless aggression.

While teammates like Jim Jackson (12 points) provided secondary support, the night belonged unequivocally to Mashburn. His 50-point performance wasn't just a personal best; it was a surgical dismantling of a proud defensive institution. As the Knicks scrambled to find an answer that never came, Mashburn’s confidence only grew, each basket a louder declaration of his dominance.

In the end, the math was simple: Mashburn outscored the entire Knicks starting backcourt by himself. On a night where offensive fireworks were scarce, one superstar provided a blinding, unforgettable light, securing a win for his team and a permanent place in the record books with a performance for the ages.
